title: Yucky video shows one snake eat another snake while huge wasp attacks it
text:
University worker Evangeline Cummings recorded this incredible video of an eastern coral snake eating a rat snake while a large wasp attacked (Pictures: Evangeline Cummings/Twitter)

If you’re scared of snakes or wasps…look away now.

Blood-curdling new video footage shows the moment one of the reptiles attempted to devour another – while a huge, angry wasp proceeded to attack it.

University of Florida worker Evangeline Cummings recorded the eastern coral snake chowing down on a rat snake in her backyard in Gainesville.

The unfortunate rat snake appeared to be dead, amid speculation it had already been attacked by a hawk, then dropped onto the branches of a rose bush.

It was spotted hanging from the plant as the coral snake started work on eating it.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

But moments later, the hungry predator faced its own challenge in the form of a large wasp that buzzed in and tried to attack it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The snake was filmed thrashing in a bid to shoo the wasp away, without much success.

Armed man steals ambulance and knocks several people down in Oslo

Cummings shared the clip on Twitter, writing: ‘Interestingly, this appears to be: a dead rat snake…and then both yellowjackets (thx for the fix) & the coral snake are showing up to devour it.

‘Don’t know how rat snake got there. Dropped by a hawk?

‘So many questions. And how does a coral snake climb the thorny rose bush!?!’

Doctoral student Natalie Claunch offered her take, and speculated that although coral snakes don’t make good climbers, the prospect of a free meal hanging from the tree would have enticed it up.

Cummings then revised her theory, adding: ‘So we’ve now settled on our favorite theory: rat snake was dropped by a hawk or similar and landed in the rosebush.

‘But the rat snake is somewhat twisted around the branches so I wonder if when it was dropped it was still partially alive and tried to free itself and could not.’
description: Evangeline Cummings recorded the clash of predators in her garden in Gainesville, Florida
